info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued March 18 at 2:22PM MDT until March 18 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Central Otero County in south central New Mexico...
* Until 515 PM MDT.
* At 221 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over Apache Summit.
HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong winds up to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 211 and 212. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 49 and 78.
Locations impacted include... Benson Ridge, Apache Summit, Cox Canyon, Boles Acres, Oliver Lee State Park, Pinon, Dry Canyon, Timberon, Mayhill, Alamogordo, Mescalero, Sixteen Springs, Hay Canyon, Sacramento, Weed, Elk Silver, Lake Mescalero, Karr Canyon, Soldier Canyon, and La Luz.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
